text:
airborne geophysical data at resolutions that could be used for exploration purposes. 
 The  under  explored  nature  of  the  terrain  is  a  positive  feature  of  the  region,  as, 
 although  the  number  of  discovered  mineral  deposits  is  small,  there  are  some 
 significant examples and it is likely that more will be discovered with persistence. To 
 the west, the best example is the Boddington Gold Deposit which was discovered in 
 1980.To the east is the Forrestania greenstone belt where a number of nickel and gold 
 deposits occur, the most significant of which is Flying Fox Nickel Mine.  The Emu 
 Rock  tenement  is  interpreted,  from  the  newly  available  detailed  aeromagnetics,  to 
 cover  a  remnant  belt  of  poorly  exposed  greenstones  and  has  potential  for  nickel 
 E70/2710  has  had  no  previous  exploration  of  any  kind  carried  and  is  only  now 
 prospective  because  of  interpreted  aeromagnetics  structures  under  sand  plain  cover.  
 Which are considered worthy of geochemical and drilling follow-up. 
 TENEMENT DETAILS AND ACCESS 
 E70/2710 consists of 55 graticular blocks for 154 sq km granted to Image Resources 
 NL on 2 February 2006.  A joint venture with Magnetic Resources NL was entered 
 into  in  October  2006  and  Magnetic  is  currently  the  operator  of  the  project.    The 
 tenement  is  located  approximately  70km  east  of  the  town  of  Hyden  and  south  of 
 Hyden-Norseman  Road.    Access  is  via  gravel  roads  and  farm  tracks.    Most  of  the 
 tenement is covered by freehold farm land (sheep, cereal crops). 
 WORK CARRIED OUT FEBRUARY 2006 TO 2007 
 Persistent waves of wet weather forced several field programs to be cancelled. 
 Eventually  some  road  side  sampling  was  achieved  but  results  suggest  that  soil 
 sampling  does  not  work  in  this  area  and  a  program  of  roadside  RAB  drilling  was 
 planned during the following field season. 
 A  review  of  the  project  failed  to  identify  targets  of  sufficient  merit  to  justify  the 
 expense  of  obtaining  land  holder  access  and  subsequent  drilling  therefore  the 
 tenement was relinquished on 1 February 2008.
